title: Have you had your 15 minutes of fame yet?

post.title: Have you had your 15 minutes of fame yet?

body:
The missile knows where it is at all times. It knows this because it knows where it isn't. By subtracting where it is from where it isn't, or where it isn't from where it is—whichever is greater—it obtains a difference, or deviation. The guidance subsystem uses deviations to generate corrective commands to drive the missile from a position where it is to a position where it isn't, and arriving at a position where it wasn't—it now is. Consequently, the position where it is, is now the position that it wasn't, and it follows that the position that it was, is now the position that it isn't.
In the event that the position that it is in is not the position that it wasn't, the system has acquired a variation; the variation being the difference between where the missile is, and where it wasn't. If variation is considered to be a significant factor, it too may be corrected by the GEA. However, the missile must also know where it was.
The missile guidance computer scenario works as follows: Because a variation has modified some of the information the missile has obtained, it is not sure just where it is. However, it is sure where it isn't, within reason, and it knows where it was. It now subtracts where it should be from where it wasn't, or vice-versa, and by differentiating this from the algebraic sum of where it shouldn't be, and where it was, it is able to obtain the deviation and its variation, which is called error.
body_html: The missile knows where it is at all times. It knows this because it knows where it isn't. By subtracting where it is from where it isn't, or where it isn't from where it is—whichever is greater—it obtains a difference, or deviation. The guidance subsystem uses deviations to generate corrective commands to drive the missile from a position where it is to a position where it isn't, and arriving at a position where it wasn't—it now is. Consequently, the position where it is, is now the position that it wasn't, and it follows that the position that it was, is now the position that it isn't. In the event that the position that it is in is not the position that it wasn't, the system has acquired a variation; the variation being the difference between where the missile is, and where it wasn't. If variation is considered to be a significant factor, it too may be corrected by the GEA. However, the missile must also know where it was. The missile guidance computer scenario works as follows: Because a variation has modified some of the information the missile has obtained, it is not sure just where it is. However, it is sure where it isn't, within reason, and it knows where it was. It now subtracts where it should be from where it wasn't, or vice-versa, and by differentiating this from the algebraic sum of where it shouldn't be, and where it was, it is able to obtain the deviation and its variation, which is called error.

body: No, but every single one of my friends is famous on whatever website or community they're in, because they're all elite and super talented at everything and good leaders. And I'm the only one who's not.

post.title: Have you had your 15 minutes of fame yet?

body:
Tbh... define fame?
  
Ive been on tv, been on radio been talked about, talked to ...but would i call it fame?
  
No. It was all vapid and meaningless. Just part of the job.

author.bio_html:

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
Yeah but the political triangle is the only thing I've ever done. I even made +foxes, and I can't even find anything to post, nor can I come up with good post titles for the life of me, and when I do post it doesn't do as well as everyone elses' do.

As for popularity, you have to be a discord janny for that (because the admins exalt you and give you special treatment for it, and they also become icons for the community). And every one of my friends who is active on ruqqus is one. I'm not particularly interested in being one since I don't spend a lot of time on discord, but what bothers me is the fact that the admins singled me out and decided that I wasn't good enough to be around them, while everyone I know they begged to do it for them for no apparent reason. And they always hated me. There are other things that they let their precious discord mods do that no one else can, such as inviting them to guildmaster stuff and special privileges that normal users don't get (because the admins think they're inherently special), and that's what irritates me the most (sounds a lot like DefaultMods unfortunately). The other thing is that the admins exalt them as the leaders of the site, which makes them get tons of recognition and popularity automatically, on top of the nearly administrative privileges they get. The admins here are not the first to do this to me either, I guess I'm just unlucky and give off vibes that make people automatically not trust me for some reason, whereas others are immediately recognized as leaders. At this point though I'm not upset about not being part of that since it's become a power user cabal, and I don't like that. I'm just mad that since I'm the only one left out, and have been a lot of other times too, it must mean I'm not good enough and all of them are. This would support my other complaints about sucking at everything. And I don't like that they gatekeep this discord thing to their exclusive clique in general, even if I were welcome in it myself.
body_html:

As for popularity, you have to be a discord janny for that (because the admins exalt you and give you special treatment for it, and they also become icons for the community). And every one of my friends who is active on ruqqus is one. I'm not particularly interested in being one since I don't spend a lot of time on discord, but what bothers me is the fact that the admins singled me out and decided that I wasn't good enough to be around them, while everyone I know they begged to do it for them for no apparent reason. And they always hated me. There are other things that they let their precious discord mods do that no one else can, such as inviting them to guildmaster stuff and special privileges that normal users don't get (because the admins think they're inherently special), and that's what irritates me the most (sounds a lot like DefaultMods unfortunately). The other thing is that the admins exalt them as the leaders of the site, which makes them get tons of recognition and popularity automatically, on top of the nearly administrative privileges they get. The admins here are not the first to do this to me either, I guess I'm just unlucky and give off vibes that make people automatically not trust me for some reason, whereas others are immediately recognized as leaders. At this point though I'm not upset about not being part of that since it's become a power user cabal, and I don't like that. I'm just mad that since I'm the only one left out, and have been a lot of other times too, it must mean I'm not good enough and all of them are. This would support my other complaints about sucking at everything. And I don't like that they gatekeep this discord thing to their exclusive clique in general, even if I were welcome in it myself.

parent.body:
Tbh... define fame?
  
Ive been on tv, been on radio been talked about, talked to ...but would i call it fame?
  
No. It was all vapid and meaningless. Just part of the job.

post.title: Have you had your 15 minutes of fame yet?

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
* Generally treated better by the admins, and they have a private discord channel with them where their input is given more weight. Actually this favoritism is more the *cause* of them being discord mods than the other way around. It started off with just one user (AngstKitten), and I don't know why. She was always a gm on admin guilds and was made a mod of the discord before it even had mods, and no one else was even welcome to ask. I don't think they even really knew each other back then, the admins just decided it as soon as they met for some reason. Then they took a liking to a few more people as they added mods to the discord. Eventually, every single one of my friends who is active on the site was invited to gm guilds and become a discord mod, and I am still the only one who was not. What bothers me the most is that back then when they were still active on ruqqus.com, I hung around the same people they started really seeing something in (including AngstKitten), so I definitely would've been associated with that group, yet I was the only one they didn't care for. They didn't even let me GM +WatchRedditDie, and I was a major mod of /r/WatchRedditDie for almost a year and still would be if the admins hadn't banned the crap out of me for no reason.

* Invited to guildmaster guilds by the admins (they refuse to invite most people).

* Near-ownership privileges on discord. They are able to bypass slowmode, are unaffected by the word filters, and are allowed to post in channels they haven't earned access to. Some of them break the server rules a lot. And the admins are perfectly okay with all this just because they're mods. They and the circlejerk userbase get angry if you criticize this, because mods are gods. Also:
* They alone can see archived channels. All the old channels that aren't active anymore the admins for some reason made impossible to view, but mods are allowed to see it.
* The can see the admins' audit log, but no one else is allowed to.
* They are allowed to create their own roles and assign themselves roles, and the admins let them do it with no consequences, but refuse to allow it for non-mods who ask.
* They are allowed to see deleted messages and all past edits of messages. This is dangerous in general but especially bad when it's a server representative of ruqqus itself and non-admins can see that.

* They are given somewhat insider information about ruqqus ahead of time so that they can be more helpful. But other users are not told these things except by them.

* The admins scrapped a feature where they would've given them junior admin permissions on the whole site. They actually tried to cover this up when I mentioned it.

* I get the impression that they talk to the admins personally a lot, based on their interactions with each other. The admins won't do this with anyone else, because they're not good enough to talk to them or some shit.

* The admins give discord mods a hell of a lot more badges than everyone else. Not a huge deal to me but it shows their favoritism.

* There are probably a few other things they get that I'm forgetting, and a few things I don't know about. But I know there's more.

But even popularity on its own is a pretty big deal, because it means everything you say and do automatically carries *much* more weight than everyone else. You pretty much control the whole community. Discord mods who are 1/10 as active as me on ruqqus.com itself still get just as many followers, and what the mods are up to is all anyone ever talks about in the discord server, so it definitely happens. Recently it's gotten so ridiculous that I'd call it a form of idolatry or celebrity worship, and it's not like those mods are even intending for that to happen, most of them are just normal people, but the circlejerk worships their gods like humans do, and the admins encourage it. It's probably because the admins distinguish them so much.

• Generally treated better by the admins, and they have a private discord channel with them where their input is given more weight. Actually this favoritism is more the cause of them being discord mods than the other way around. It started off with just one user (AngstKitten), and I don't know why. She was always a gm on admin guilds and was made a mod of the discord before it even had mods, and no one else was even welcome to ask. I don't think they even really knew each other back then, the admins just decided it as soon as they met for some reason. Then they took a liking to a few more people as they added mods to the discord. Eventually, every single one of my friends who is active on the site was invited to gm guilds and become a discord mod, and I am still the only one who was not. What bothers me the most is that back then when they were still active on ruqqus.com, I hung around the same people they started really seeing something in (including AngstKitten), so I definitely would've been associated with that group, yet I was the only one they didn't care for. They didn't even let me GM +WatchRedditDie, and I was a major mod of /r/WatchRedditDie for almost a year and still would be if the admins hadn't banned the crap out of me for no reason.

  • Invited to guildmaster guilds by the admins (they refuse to invite most people).

  • Near-ownership privileges on discord. They are able to bypass slowmode, are unaffected by the word filters, and are allowed to post in channels they haven't earned access to. Some of them break the server rules a lot. And the admins are perfectly okay with all this just because they're mods. They and the circlejerk userbase get angry if you criticize this, because mods are gods. Also:

  • They alone can see archived channels. All the old channels that aren't active anymore the admins for some reason made impossible to view, but mods are allowed to see it.

  • The can see the admins' audit log, but no one else is allowed to.

  • They are allowed to create their own roles and assign themselves roles, and the admins let them do it with no consequences, but refuse to allow it for non-mods who ask.

  • They are allowed to see deleted messages and all past edits of messages. This is dangerous in general but especially bad when it's a server representative of ruqqus itself and non-admins can see that.

  • They are given somewhat insider information about ruqqus ahead of time so that they can be more helpful. But other users are not told these things except by them.

  • The admins scrapped a feature where they would've given them junior admin permissions on the whole site. They actually tried to cover this up when I mentioned it.

  • I get the impression that they talk to the admins personally a lot, based on their interactions with each other. The admins won't do this with anyone else, because they're not good enough to talk to them or some shit.

  • The admins give discord mods a hell of a lot more badges than everyone else. Not a huge deal to me but it shows their favoritism.

  • There are probably a few other things they get that I'm forgetting, and a few things I don't know about. But I know there's more.

But even popularity on its own is a pretty big deal, because it means everything you say and do automatically carries much more weight than everyone else. You pretty much control the whole community. Discord mods who are 1/10 as active as me on ruqqus.com itself still get just as many followers, and what the mods are up to is all anyone ever talks about in the discord server, so it definitely happens. Recently it's gotten so ridiculous that I'd call it a form of idolatry or celebrity worship, and it's not like those mods are even intending for that to happen, most of them are just normal people, but the circlejerk worships their gods like humans do, and the admins encourage it. It's probably because the admins distinguish them so much.

body: You're 100000000x better at posting than me, at least in +foxes. It takes me hours just to find one good picture, and when I do I can't even think of a halfway decent title for the life of me. I'm sure you'd blow me away at everything else too. Fame is a poor measure of success, it comes from catering to everything the masses want, not truly doing something cool.

Fame is a poor measure of success, it comes from catering to everything the masses want, not truly doing something cool.

body: I do find when using Google Image Search that using Tools > Size > Large does tend to result in NICER images (not just larger) because pro photographers shooting in large sizes also set up nicer shots than average.

author.bio: god, what a bad run this site was.
author.bio_html: god, what a bad run this site was.

body:
kek, I literally go on 4chan and steal the title from whatever some retard is saying in the thread ;p and bruh, you recognise me???

and baby, I certainly would not blow you away in anything else either, i dont do it with anyone irl, certainly wouldnt do it with anyone online 

I hope you feel better about yourself soon, and find something you truly care about. that's something no one can take away from you, and something you will truly brilliance in whether you think you can or not.

and baby, I certainly would not blow you away in anything else either, i dont do it with anyone irl, certainly wouldnt do it with anyone online
